headline.main: Pitaro Named Chair of Disney Consumer Products, Interactive
headline.print_headline: Pitaro Named Chair of Disney Consumer Products, Interactive

docs.snippet: Jimmy Pitaro, a former Yahoo media executive who joined Disney in 2010, has been promoted to chairman of its consumer products and interactive media division....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jimmy Pitaro, a former Yahoo media executive who joined Disney in 2010, has been promoted to chairman of its consumer products and interactive media division.

headline.main: Colorado Can Enforce Its 'Amazon Tax' Law: U.S. Appeals Court
headline.print_headline: Colorado Can Enforce Its 'Amazon Tax' Law: U.S. Appeals Court

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court endorsed a Colorado law designed to make it easier for the state to collect sales taxes on out-of-state purchases made over the Internet....
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court endorsed a Colorado law designed to make it easier for the state to collect sales taxes on out-of-state purchases made over the Internet.

headline.main: Puerto Rico May Issue Delayed Audited 2014 Statements in April
headline.print_headline: Puerto Rico May Issue Delayed Audited 2014 Statements in April

docs.snippet: Puerto Rico's much-delayed audited financial statements for 2014 are expected to be finished and issued by April, the U.S. territory's governor said in a letter to U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Puerto Rico's much-delayed audited financial statements for 2014 are expected to be finished and issued by April, the U.S. territory's governor said in a letter to U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan on Monday.

headline.main: Senate Clears Way for Approval of New FDA Commissioner
headline.print_headline: Senate Clears Way for Approval of New FDA Commissioner

docs.snippet: The Senate has cleared the way for approval of President Barack Obama's nominee for commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate has cleared the way for approval of President Barack Obama's nominee for commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration.

headline.main: Cable Company Founder Rigas Leaves Prison in Early Release
headline.print_headline: Cable Company Founder Rigas Leaves Prison in Early Release

docs.snippet: The dying 91-year-old founder of what was once among the nation's largest cable television companies left prison Monday, three days after a judge ordered he be released early, his lawyer said....
docs.lead_paragraph: The dying 91-year-old founder of what was once among the nation's largest cable television companies left prison Monday, three days after a judge ordered he be released early, his lawyer said.

headline.main: Minnesota Revoking License Plate Offensive to Muslims
headline.print_headline: Minnesota Revoking License Plate Offensive to Muslims

headline.main: Experts Identify New Cases of Syria Chemical Attacks
headline.print_headline: Experts Identify New Cases of Syria Chemical Attacks

docs.snippet: The international body charged with establishing who is responsible for chemical attacks in Syria said Monday it has identified seven potential sites for investigation, which it hopes to begin next month....
docs.lead_paragraph: The international body charged with establishing who is responsible for chemical attacks in Syria said Monday it has identified seven potential sites for investigation, which it hopes to begin next month.

headline.main: Lynn Nottage Wins Blackburn Prize for ‘Sweat’

docs.snippet: The prize for “Sweat,” the acclaimed drama about deindustrialization in a working-class city in Pennsylvania, includes a $25,000 check....

headline.main: Winds Blow Small Amount of Radiation Onto Washington Highway
headline.print_headline: Winds Blow Small Amount of Radiation Onto Washington Highway

docs.snippet: The uncontrolled spread of small amounts of radioactive waste at Hanford after a Nov. 17 windstorm is alarming, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency said in a letter to the Department of Energy....
docs.lead_paragraph: The uncontrolled spread of small amounts of radioactive waste at Hanford after a Nov. 17 windstorm is alarming, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency said in a letter to the Department of Energy.

headline.main: Senate Banking Panel Democrats Seek Action on Obama Nominees
headline.print_headline: Senate Banking Panel Democrats Seek Action on Obama Nominees

docs.snippet: Senate Banking Committee Democrats on Monday asked the panel's Republican chairman in a letter to "clear the backlog" of 16 nominations by President Barack Obama to posts related to financial oversight, national security and other areas....
docs.lead_paragraph: Senate Banking Committee Democrats on Monday asked the panel's Republican chairman in a letter to "clear the backlog" of 16 nominations by President Barack Obama to posts related to financial oversight, national security and other areas.
